intro: Blepharodon hitchcockii, commonly known as the Hitchcock's blepharodon, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
